adjective.description: Botany. Having the stipules united by cohesion into an ocrea or sheath surrounding the stem.
Ornithology. Having the tarsal envelope fused into a boot. rare.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in John Lindley (1799–1865), botanist and horticulturist. From classical Latin ocreātus wearing greaves or leggings from ocrea + -ātus.
